intro: Monnina macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to parts of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the family Onagraceae, which includes species like willows and evening primroses. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Monnina macrophylla thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
